content.question: The cities of Edmonton and Calgary are relatively far north and at high elevation. Which of the following best explains the data presented in their ecological footprints?

choices.label: Many of the inhabitants of Edmonton and Calgary must commute to southern cities for work.
Products must be shipped large distances from major shipping ports to Edmonton and Calgary.
Growing seasons are shorter in Edmonton and Calgary, requiring larger amounts of fertilizers to grow crops.
Colder average temperatures and longer nights in Edmonton and Calgary lead to high energy usage to heat and light homes.

content.answer: Colder average temperatures and longer nights in Edmonton and Calgary lead to high energy usage to heat and light homes.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
